case_vignette: A 25-year-old man presents to the emergency department with altered mental status. The patient has not been feeling well since yesterday, and this morning his roommate found him unarousable. The patient is generally healthy and is a college athlete. He recently broke his nose in a soccer game, and it is currently healing with only gauze in his nose to stop occasional bleeding. He otherwise has no significant medical history. His temperature is 102°F (38.9°C), blood pressure is 87/58 mmHg, pulse is 130/min, respirations are 24/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Physical exam is notable for the finding in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I've been feeling really unwell since yesterday, and today my friend found me and I couldn't be woken up.

I haven't mentioned any headache or dizziness.

No, I haven't mentioned any joint pain or muscle aches.

I haven't mentioned any recent travel or being around someone who's sick.

I haven't mentioned any changes in my weight or appetite.

I'm a man, so I don't have a menstrual cycle.
Have you had any recent changes in your sexual activity?
I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my sexual activity.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress level or sleep patterns?
I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my stress level or sleep patterns.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my diet or eating habits.
Have you had any recent changes in your work or school schedule?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my work or school schedule.

I haven't mentioned any changes in my living environment or personal life.
